comment._content: Joan Travell Orenstein (1923-2009) just died this fall. Travell studied sociology on scholarship at the LSE. She emigrated to Canada after WWII, as a war bride. They had six daughters. In her spare (!) time in Halifax, Joan began writing for radio and TV. In the 1960s, she began acting, and was a successful performer in Canadian film, stage, and television productions until her late 70s. v1.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/LAC.20091113.OBORENS... Her daughter Sarah Orenstein is an actress who closely resembles Joan: garygoddardagency.com/clients/sarah-orenstein
